topic: How to observe stream processing using fastapi with Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to observe stream processing using fastapi with Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Observing Stream Processing in FastAPI using Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide demonstrates how to implement real-time data streaming and processing using FastAPI, a modern web framework for building APIs with Python 3.12+, along with appropriate libraries.
key_points: Utilize FastAPI for developing high-performance web APIs in Python 3.12+
Implement stream processing using the ASGI (Async Server Gateway Interface)
Leverage libraries like Uvicorn and websockets to handle streaming and websocket connections
Demonstrate real-time data processing using a simple example

code_examples.code:
from fastapi import FastAPI, WebSocket
app = FastAPI()

@app.websocket('/ws/stream')
def stream(websocket: WebSocket):
    async for message in websocket:
        data = json.loads(await message)
        # Process real-time data here

version_notes: This example is based on Python 3.12+, FastAPI v0.75.0, and Uvicorn v0.19.0
Please ensure you have these versions installed before running the code
caveats: Stream processing with FastAPI requires a compatible ASGI server such as Uvicorn
This example focuses on JSON data handling, but other formats may be processed using appropriate libraries
